body:
```
(16:10:44) abcdefg30: well, openra out of memory again
(16:11:15) penev: sinfonia was complaining of the same thing
(16:11:37) antares79: abcdefg30: can you checkout dacf094956fc8204cfba32bd089fe24325678bb6 and see if it happens there, too?
(16:13:52) abcdefg30: moment
(16:14:05) abcdefg30: gone
(16:14:43) antares79: abcdefg30: how about 732001f3f32e7eac844a4f3cafe312072cd9f711?
(16:15:28) abcdefg30: problem there again
(16:15:45) antares79: we have a winner then: #7696
```

I can't reproduce it on Windows 8.1 (6.3.9600), but I have a suspicion this is because the version of SharpFont isn't getting updated. I changed the way fixed-point decimals were being returned from a raw `int` to `Fixed26Dot6` and `Fixed16Dot16` structs.

For ease of use, I included implicit casts to `float`, `double`, and `decimal` and an explicit cast to `int`. I didn't realize that on older versions of SharpFont, the `int` cast would effectively do nothing where there used to be a `value >> 6`.

If you have an older version of SharpFont, every glyph that you build will be 64x it's actual size, which could probably make you run out of memory very quickly.

OS X 10.10.3:

Does fetching https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7953 and `make clean && make all` fix it?
